infotexts.fabricationdescription.rareearth: Scandium, yttrium, or lanthanides except promethium.
infotexts.entitydescription.beaker: Suitable to most simple chemical reactions.
infotexts.entitydescription.distillationdevice: Evaporate and collect liquids. It may take a bit longer time.
infotexts.entitydescription.hydrogentank: Dangerous fuel, completely prohibited. Can be refilled by oxygenerators.
infotexts.entitydescription.hydrogenstoringalloyta: Rare earth-nickel alloy inside is able to store massive hydrogen safely. Can be refilled by oxygenerators.
infotexts.entitydescription.boron: Metalloid with properties complex and unique, usages even more various.
infotexts.entitydescription.ammonia: Ammonia is the best source of nitrogen in chemical synthesis.
infotexts.entitydescription.sulphur: Smelly yellow solid mainly used to make black powder and sulphuric acid.
infotexts.entitydescription.vanadium: Uncommon metal. One of its oxides is a perfect catalyst of sulphuric acid production.
infotexts.entitydescription.chromium: Hardest among metals, and not too expensive.
infotexts.entitydescription.manganese: Crispy metal. Its compounds have wide usages.
infotexts.entitydescription.gallium: Melts in hand. Used to produce thermometers and semiconductor materials, also ID cards.
infotexts.entitydescription.arsenic: Looks like metal but crumbly. Poisonous.
infotexts.entitydescription.bromine: Extracted from marine water, extremely stinky.
infotexts.entitydescription.silver: Valuable metal used to make medals. Its ions can sterilize wounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.tungsten: Heavy and hard, with highest melt point among metals.
infotexts.entitydescription.platinum: Precious metal, catalyst of ammonia synthesis.
infotexts.entitydescription.gold: Its value does not need explanations.
infotexts.entitydescription.mercury: Is liquid at room temperature, can dissolve many metals. Toxic.
infotexts.entitydescription.disulphuricacid: React mildly with water to generate sulphuric acid.
infotexts.entitydescription.potassiumchlorate: Strong oxidant. Causes a big bang even with sugar.
infotexts.entitydescription.potassiumnitrate: One material of black powder. Also a type of fertilizer.
infotexts.entitydescription.potassiumpermanganate: Strong oxidant. Mainly used to disinfect.
infotexts.entitydescription.silveramalgam: Silver-mercury alloy that can be separated by distillation.
infotexts.entitydescription.aluminiumamalgam1: Mercury with some aluminium dissolved. Reacts violently when coming into contact with water, and can be separated by distillation.
infotexts.entitydescription.aluminiumamalgam2: Mercury with a lot of aluminium dissolved. Becomes extremely dangerous when coming into contact with water, and can be separated by distillation.
infotexts.entitydescription.goldamalgam: Gold-mercury alloy that can be separated by distillation.
infotexts.entitydescription.silvercommendation: A small medal fashioned out of copper and silver, made out of Commendation. When applied to another crewmember's body, it instantly bestows them with the experience 3 times of Commendation.
infotexts.entitydescription.silvermedal: A small medal fashioned out of bronze and silver, made out of Medal. When applied to another crewmember's body, it instantly bestows them with the experience 3 times of Medal.
infotexts.entitydescription.silverionglue: Antibiotic Glue made out of silver ion, cheaper but not so effecient as general antibiotic glue.
infotexts.entitydescription.goldcommendation: A small medal fashioned out of copper and gold, made out of Commendation. When applied to another crewmember's body, it instantly bestows them with the experience 10 times of Commendation.
infotexts.entitydescription.goldmedal: A small medal fashioned out of bronze and gold, made out of Medal. When applied to another crewmember's body, it instantly bestows them with the experience 10 times of Medal.
infotexts.entitydescription.v2o5crate: A metal crate with some divanadium pentaoxide powder inside.
infotexts.entitydescription.vanadinitecrystal: Beautiful crystal which takes some time to form.
infotexts.entitydescription.whitearsenic: Fatal poison even slowlier than sufforin.
infotexts.entitydescription.arsenicantidote: An antidote for acute cyanide poisoning.
infotexts.entitydescription.blackpowderpack: An explosive with power weaker than UEX.
infotexts.entitydescription.physicoriumcannonball: Causes massive damage to both walls and giant creatures. Extra lacerations for creatures.
infotexts.entitydescription.caststeelcannon: An ancient cannon which requires black powder to fire.
infotexts.entitydescription.physicoriummusketproje: Little material used but strong power.
infotexts.entitydescription.revolvermusket: Capacity is 4. The condition bar demonstrates remaining black powder.
infotexts.entitydescription.musket: Consumes black powder to shoot projectiles. The accuracy is NOT guaranteed.
infotexts.entitydescription.pulselaserammoboxvanad: A box of containing some vanadinite crystals. It changes the colour of laser and is more durable.
infotexts.entitydescription.shiningsword: Deals five types of resistless damage with its amazing power.
infotexts.entitydescription.wrenchplated: A wrench plated with hard metal. The strengthened material allows for little more efficient repairs and super swings.
infotexts.entitydescription.screwdriverplated: A screwdriver plated with hard metal. The strengthened material allows for little more efficient repairs and super swings.
infotexts.entitydescription.crowbarplated: A crowbar plated with hard metal. Damage armored targets effectively.
infotexts.entitydescription.ultimatewrench: A Superb tool and strong weapon that only mechanical masters can rein.
infotexts.entitydescription.znmndrycell: Zinc-Manganese Dry Cell. Extremely cheap but NOT rechargeable.
infotexts.entitydescription.incandescentlight: Old type light bulb, bright enough but consumes more power.
infotexts.entitydescription.halogenlight: Halogen injected. It's now a little better than normal incandescent lights.
infotexts.entitydescription.advancedglass: Resistant. Mainly used in production of many instruments.
infotexts.entitydescription.nh3bh3tank: A tank storing hydrogen with nitrogen-boron compounds. Small capacity due to immature technology.
infotexts.entitydescription.fluorescentpowder: Powder shaved off from ID cards. Contains gallium.
infotexts.entitydescription.asgacircuit: Gallium arsenide semiconductor applied. Function much stronger than FPGA circuit.
infotexts.entitydescription.masterkey: An ID card that looks strange.
infotexts.entitydescription.smartheater: Looks like a kind of cooker, but is much too expensive.
infotexts.entitydescription.flusk: Used in reactions refer to liquids. Heatable.
infotexts.entitydescription.condenser: Transfer gas went through into liquid with cold water.
infotexts.entitydescription.thermometer: Made from gallium, with super measuring range.
infotexts.entitydescription.edta2na: Ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid disodium salt, which can relieve all kinds of heavy metal poisioning.
infotexts.entitydescription.dimethylmercury: One of the most dangerous mercury compounds. It can even penetrate latex gloves.
infotexts.entitydescription.advancedsprayer: Little consumption, super range and all paints supported.
infotexts.entitydescription.brominewaterdilute: Got this by passing chlorine into marine water. It can be concentrated by medical fabricator.
infotexts.entitydescription.brominewaterconcentrat: It really stinks. Distill to get liquid bromine.
infotexts.entitydescription.silverore: A mineral containing large amounts of silver.
infotexts.entitydescription.cerargyrite: A mineral composed of silver and chlorine.
infotexts.entitydescription.carnotite: A mineral containing potassium, vanadium and uranium.
infotexts.entitydescription.cavansite: A mineral containing calcium, vanadium and silicon.
infotexts.entitydescription.argentite: A mineral composed of silver and sulphur.
infotexts.entitydescription.realgar: A mineral consisting of arsenic and sulphur.
infotexts.entitydescription.orpiment: A mineral composed of arsenic and sulphur.
infotexts.entitydescription.sperrylite: A mineral composed of platinum and arsenic.
infotexts.entitydescription.chromite: A mineral containing iron and chromium.
infotexts.entitydescription.crocoite: A mineral containing lead and chromium.
infotexts.entitydescription.nickeline: A mineral composed of nickel and arsenic.
infotexts.entitydescription.violarite: A mineral composed of nickel, iron and sulphur.
infotexts.entitydescription.monazite: A mineral containing lanthanides and phosphorus.
infotexts.entitydescription.ferberite: A mineral containing iron and tungsten.
infotexts.entitydescription.scheelite: A mineral containing calcium and tungsten.
infotexts.entitydescription.borax: A mineral containing sodium and boron.
infotexts.entitydescription.priceite: A mineral containing calcium and boron.
infotexts.entitydescription.cinnabar: A mineral composed of mercury and sulphur.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.arsenicpoison: You have died of arsenic poisoning.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.arsenicpoisoning: The patient is seemingly sick, and without a prompt treatment they will only get worse.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.arsenicpoisoning.h: The patient has been poisoned and is vomiting acutely. Unless an antidote is found, the patient will eventually die in agony.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.arsenicpoisoning.m: You have a headache and fatigue. The nausea is getting worse over time.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.arsenicpoisoning.l: The arsenic content in the patient's body severely exceeded the limit.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.mercurypoison: You have died of mercury poisoning.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.mercurypoisoning: The patient has been poisoned to obnubination. Unless an antidote is found, the patient will eventually die in agony.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.mercurypoisoning.h: The patient has vital signs, but mercury has thoroughly invaded the brain. There is nothing to do.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.mercurypoisoning.m: You have a headache......who and where I am?
infotexts.afflictiondescription.mercurypoisoning.l: The mercury content in the patient's body severely exceeded the limit.
